result.execSummary:
The defendant Jovon Diante Bethly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% prison wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the  Challenge Incarceration program and the Wisconsin Substance Abue program after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
No illegal drugs. No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community or Jesse J.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include those as listed.
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised:   that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovon Diante Bethly

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA HEARING & SENTENCING Transcript (33 pages) commencing OCTOBER 15, 2014 received and filed. kl

Defendant Jovon Diante Bethly in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Jovon Diante Bethly in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Stingl).  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Jesse J.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Scott Mcclune in court, defendant Jovon Diante Bethly not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB

Defendant Jovon Diante Bethly in court with attorney Scott Mcclune.  Defendant Jovon Diante Bethly in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nicholas Kropp-MPD Officer, Troy Jankowski-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JESSE J. (5/24/89).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jovon Diante Bethly in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Jovon Diante Bethly in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
